column1: full and shaping into the pads, he clips this neatly behind square, wide of fine leg for an easy two to start
137kph, good length, no swing, angled across, he's half forward and defending towards mid off
138kph, half-volley on leg stump and Finch climbs into this pinging it off his toes forward of square! Superb shot
140kph, full outside off, he strokes this neatly to cover and the man misfields, it allows for an easy single
139kph, good length angled into off stump, he defends with firm hands from the crease
beaten prodding from the crease at a good length ball wide of off. He was expecting it coming back but it just held it's line
131kph, good length, fourth stump, he defends on the front foot
good length outside off, he drives neatly on the up to mid off
back of a length, this stops in the surface a touch as he punches off the back foot to cover
132kph, back of a length on off, he's up on his toes and working this with the bottom beautifully wide of mid on with superb timing for a couple
130kph, good length, fourth stump line, he's forward and defending into the off side
full outside off, he drives flowingly but can't beat mid off as Hasnain makes a good save
142kph, good length, he's on the crease pushing with an open face to point
play and miss from the crease at a 138kph, back of a length ball well wide off. He just wafted at it with concrete feet
cracking square drive on the up! What a stroke from Khawaja. It was not that full but width was offered and he got a great stride in and crushed it through cover-point
edged and just short of the Rizwan! Good length outside off, he pushes from the crease, gets an edge but soft hands means the edge falls well short of the keeper
another edge closing the face trying to work to leg, it flies safely through the gully and runs to third man for a single
back of a length, 139kph, he stands tall and punches off the back foot but can't beat cover
back of a length, outside off, he's back and defending with an open blade towards point
he's taken on the pad and there is an appeal for LBW but it's way too high. It hit him on the thigh pad as he tried to turn it behind square
play and miss attempting to drive on the up wide of off. That was a loose stroke. Nowhere near full enough to drive that
beaten again prodding defensively at a similar length and line wide of off. Well bowled
133kph, fuller on off stump, he works this off the front foot to mid on
fuller length wide of off, he drives inside out to cover-point but can't beat the man moving to his left from point
142kph, good length on off, Finch is caught on the crease and gets a thick inside edge that runs to wide fine leg. That was well bowled
143kph, good length, fourth stump line, he pushes on the front foot opening the face and stroking it to cover

nearly a run out but Shan Masood misses at the non-striker's end! Khawaja hit it straight to point and took on Shan, he had a lot of time to gather and throw but it was just wide. Khawaja was miles out!
good length, fourth stump line, he's half forward and defending on the front foot
139kph, good length, targeting off stump, he defends with the full face, his bat is well infront of the pad
glorious drive down the ground! This was over-pitched outside off, Finch just leaned forward and drove it beautifully between the bowler and mid off and barely had to run. he looks in top form.
he square drives a wider ball on the up past backward point but wide third man gets around to keep it to one
good length, angled wide of off, he defends on the front foot to point
good length, fourth stump line, he strides forward and pushes this to mid off
134kph, fuller outside off, he drives but without any timing and picks out cover
half-volley wide of off and Finch helps himself with another supreme cover drive that pierces the field at pace! Lovely shot
back of a length, Finch is back and dropping this with soft hands into the off side and pinching a single. Well played
138kph, good length angled into off, he defends from the crease, squirting this to backward point
fuller outside off, he pushes on the front foot to cover
143kph, angled into middle stump, he turns this off the front foot through forward square to the sweeper
play and miss attempting to pull a ball that is not that short outside off! He played straight over the top of it as it skidded lower wide of off
he gets pinned by a sharp bouncer on the shoulder! That got up quickly. He went to pull and then it really hurried him, just going past the gloves and hitting the right shoulder. He's fine.
fuller on off, he is half forward driving to mid off
he angles the blade and runs this to third man and it races across the outfield and beats Yasir! That was nicely played as Yasir was very wide. He just opened the face and ran it fine
132kph, good length, top off, he sits back and whips this straight to midwicket
good length, on off stump, he defends on the front foot to cover
full on middle and off, he mistimes a drive dragging this to mid on
131kph, fuller outside off, he drives elegantly but straight to the man at mid off
slower ball, 116kph, good length, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
135kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to cover
137kph, good length outside off, again he wafts at it from the crease trying to angle it to third man and misses
he runs this down to third man for a single, better footwork to get back and across and angle the bat with control
141kph, bouncer, very high and Finch ducks under it easily
138kph, back of a length, angled into middle and off, he's back and turning this around the corner to fine leg with ease
beaten again trying to fend at a good length wide of off. Again he didn't move his feet trying to just open the blade and run it to third man
132kph, back of a length outside off, he is back and punching firmly to cover
back of a length on off, he's back and working this against the angle to midwicket
Finch walks down the track early and mistimes a drive dragging it to mid on
back of a length, 129kph, outside off, he punches off the back foot straight to one of two catching covers
131kph, shorter length, he's back and cutting but not nailing it, finding the man on the ring at point
he launches this over long on! Out of nowhere, frustrated by picking out fielders, he got one in the slot and just launched into it, from the crease he lofted it high over long on into the stands!
a bouncer first up, it hurries Khawaja as he hooks this, rolling the wrists to get it to fine leg along the ground
140kph, he drives on the up to mid off, they think about one but wisely stay home, Imad fires at the striker's end, hits the stumps and they get a single on the ricochet!
fuller on middle, he wristily whips this through midwicket for a couple
141kph, fuller length outside off, he tries to drive and mistimes this dragging it to mid on
140kph, short ball, he controls a pull shot well forward of square to a sweeper in the deep

magnificent straight drive! Almost a caught and bowled chance but Finch smoked it so quickly back past him he had no chance. It wasn't a half-volley but he stood tall and drove it hard through the line back past Hasnain
tossed up outside off, he reaches forward and defends
a reverse sweep and he beats short third man! It was outside off, he set up early, got the length he wanted and picked the gap past short third man with nice timing
tossed up outside off, he drives, turning the wrists to work it to long on
drifting into leg stump, he clips this through square leg with control for a couple
tossed up on middle and leg, he drives firmly to long on
shaped to reverse and then changed his mind and tried a conventional sweep, it clipped the pad and was blocked by Rizwan

LBW! Hasnain breaks through! Full and straight, just tailing in a touch, Finch hangs right back in his crease and tries to whip square and is beaten for pace. He is hit right infront of leg stump and is given out! Finch didn't review. He was annoyed he missed it. Hasnain has a wicket to remember!
142kph, good length angling across the left-hander and he leaves it alone
beaten by a beauty! 143kph, good length, shaping late past the groping bat of Marsh as he prodded from the crease
143kph, fuller length, he defends with soft hands towards mid off who is deep and calls for a single immediately. Well run
144kph, full on middle and leg, he whips this elegantly through square leg to the sweeper in the deep
short and wide of off, he jumps in the air trying to get on top of a cut but chops it down off the bottom edge to second slip
tossed up outside off, he drives down to long on
darted in flatter towards off, he defends from the crease to the bowler
tossed up on off, he whips this off the front foot to square leg
shorter and sliding on, he is pushing from the crease but can't beat midwicket
floated up on off, he reaches out and defends with the full face
flatter and quicker, he's back and defending towards midwicket
142kph, full and angled across and he flashes and misses at a drive. Beaten for pace
141kph, back of a length, he tries to whip square but is hit on the thigh pad
142kph, fuller on off, he whips extravagantly through forward square to the sweeper in the deep
short ball, 137kph, he pulls powerfully but straight to deep square
145kph, back of a length on off, he's back and working this square past the square leg umpire
tries to square drive from the crease and gets a thick bottom edge that runs to third man for one
floated up on middle and leg, and it's tucked to midwicket
Imad fumbles a stop as another full one is tapped back to him, but they decide not to run on the misfield
spinning down the leg side, flicking the pad on the way through. Imad is finding some turn when he gives the ball a little more air
nudged with the spin to midwicket

Marsh runs past one! He left his crease, looking to get to the pitch, but he just never got there and his momentum was still taking him forward even as the ball spun past his inside edge and Rizwan whipped the bails off
chipped uppishly, but well wide of the bowler. It just stopped on Handscomb as he lunged forward at it. Mid on trots around to cut it off
Hasnain comes around the stumps, offering Khawaja width outside off. It's driven, but there's protection in the deep
slanting down the leg side, and Rizwan dives smartly at his left to save extras
that's better from the young quick, aiming for the top of off. Defended to cover
Handscomb sends a length delivery bouncing out to the cover sweeper with a crunchy punch, and the fielder in the deep is caught napping a little as they take him on for a second run
just a hint of shape in to the batsman, and a drive is stopped at cover
Khawaja steps into a fluent drive, long off getting around the boundary to keep them to two
whipped out into the leg side, and a single keeps him on strike
Khawaja bends low to sweep, and it doesn't get far but there's time for a single
punched out through cover, off the back foot
flapped one-handed into the leg side, but he can't beat the field
Khawaja reverse sweeps, Umar Akmal diving over the ball at short third man to allow runs
that's a much better stop from Shan Masood, who dives smartly to his left to stop a powerfully-struck orthodox sweep
flicked off the pads for a single
lobbed up and well wide of Khawaja, who lets it pass him
legbreak, but nothing extravagant and Khawaja works him fine of short fine leg
Handscomb stays deep and presses to cover
nurdled into the leg side, Handscomb again playing him from the crease
floating towards leg stump, and it's neatly flicked off the toes
punched firmly off the back foot, but he can't beat the fielder in the ring
swept hard, but he finds the fielder at deep backward square
Handscomb gives the cover sweeper some work to do, the batsmen trotting through for a single
Khawaja sets himself for a reverse sweep, but the ball's not where he wants it so he reverts to the paddle sweep at the last moment, tucking it nice and fine
beaten outside off by one that doesn't turn as expected
glanced off the hip, but straight at the fielder
was there an edge here? Yes! Imad finds the edge of a forward poke, but it's quite thick and Rizwan can't get his gloves around it. Tough chance, but a chance all the same
Khawaja stays deep and flicks wristily to midwicket
wonderful placement from Khawaja, threading a measured drive through the gap at cover and right between the fielders in the deep to pick up four
another reverse sweep, and he doesn't get all of it but they find a single
a touch too full, outside off, and Handscomb drives to long off
Khawaja drives, but this time the shot is stopped by a tumbling cover fielder
flicked off the pads and down to fine leg
speared in flat outside off, but Khawaja meets it with a confident slog sweep, lifting the ball over midwicket. It looks like he's got the measure of this pitch now
a single behind square on the off side turns the strike over

caught at slip! Imad had kept the slip in for Handscomb since he arrived at the crease, and it's paid off. The batsman comes down and tries to flick to leg, but the ball - which is flighted, and spins - takes a thick edge, bouncing off the pad and flying at a comfortable catching height to slip
eased down to long off, and he's off the mark straight away
punched firmly back at Imad, who creaks slowly into a dive as it bounces under him to allow a single

bowled by a googly! Pitched up and straight. Stoinis is expecting the legbreak, and plays down the wrong line. The ball doesn't turn big, but it's enough to beat him, zipping through the gate to hit the stumps
flighted, outside off, and a drive bounces down to long off
Khawaja leans forward with an angled bat, getting it behind point for a single
Yasir gives it plenty of air, and Maxwell's drive is stopped at cover
worked wide of mid on for a single
Khawaja looks to nudge a full one away into the leg side, but he can't find the gap
Maxwell takes his bottom hand off the bat as he slices a drive through point

misfield at long on! It's Hasnain. Khawaja pushed it softly down the ground, and Hasnain should have stopped it easily, but he lets it go past for four and that's Khawaja's fifty. It went right through his legs
pushed defensively into the leg side
pressed out to the cover sweeper for a single
flicked just wide of midwicket, quick single
Khawaja works off his pad, and he'll keep the strike
whipped smartly off the toes, and out to midwicket
slapped with purpose, but straight to point
swatted over long on! Maxwell spotted a flighted delivery outside off, planted his front foot down the track, and lifted it cleanly over long on

is this a missed chance? Yes! Maxwell backs away to cut off the stumps, but he gets a thin edge. Rizwan took his eye off it behind the stumps, perhaps expecting that it would hit the stumps. The ball bounces out of his gloves, and Maxwell survives
straight, and it's worked to leg for a single
Imad attacks the stumps, Maxwell defends
paddled down to fine leg. It's not quite the sweep, more of a front foot paddle, but it goes fine of Umar Akmal at short fine leg and away for runs
punched out to the sweeper for a single
Khawaja whips across a drifting delivery, turning the strike over with a single
placed through cover point, just the one
this keeps a little low, but Khawaja jabs down on it in time and collects a single to long on
Khawaja reads the length early and employs his wrists to milk a single into the leg side
Maxwell is forward when he should have been back and a thick outside edge lobs through the area where gully would have been
nudged to mid on, where Shinwari is well inside the circle
Maxwell sets himself for a big heave into the leg side, but the ball rushes on to him, coming of the inside half of the shot and bouncing into the leg side
timing and placement! Khawaja has put in the work getting himself in, and he's finding some fluency now, bending into a reverse sweep that goes exactly where he want it to
Yasir ends with a quicker ball that is tucked defensively to leg
flighted on middle and leg, and it's flicked behind square
Haris is much slower through the air, this one floating down at 81km/h, Khawaja dabbing to short third man
worked to midwicket
the same shot goes just wide of that midwicket fielder this time, and there's room for a single
Maxwell gets back and waits deep in the crease, but his punch finds cover
quick hands! Haris strays down leg, and Maxwell punishes him, whipping his hands down into a very fine sweep

Khawaja misses a sweep! He'd been playing the shot so well, but he just missed this straighter one from Yasir. The appeal is immediate and emotive, and Umpire Dharmasena raises the finger. Khawaja departs just as he was looking to kick on for a hard-fought 62, and Pakistan keep themselves in the game
nicely flighted on middle and off, Carey nudging watchfully into the leg side
straight again, but fuller this time and Carey is off the mark with a glance to fine leg
this one is flighted up just a bit too high, Maxwell driving a full toss out to long off
Carey is forward and defends the ball with slightly hard hands, but smothers it well enough
pushed down to long on for a single
swept through square leg, just the one
front foot defence squirts to cover
Maxwell looks for a single close in on the leg side, but there's none to be had
pressed firmly down to long off for one
Carey comes forward to defend with the spin into the leg side
glanced off his pads for a single
Carey picks up where Khawaja left off! A competent reverse sweep sends the ball bouncing away behind square for his first boundary
orthodox sweep now, and the fielder in the deep keeps them to two
another sweep from Carey, but Shan Masood dives at short fine leg to stop it
nicely flighted, on middle and leg, and Maxwell defends
another legbreak, slightly flatter, and Maxwell drives softly to cover
he's forward again, driving to mid off
he starts full, just outside off, and Carey pings the cover field with a drive
Carey comes forward again, angling his dab to run the ball to gully
Shinwari keeps it full, and a drive is stopped at mid off
Shinwari attacks the stumps, Carey nudging with the angle into the leg side
he hits a length, just outside off, and Maxwell pokes watchfully to cover
Maxwell uses his bottom hand to work the ball into the gap near midwicket, and keeps the strike
nearly caught at long on! It was tossed up outside off, he hammers this hard and flat at long on, Junaid comes it but doesn't get there and just bounces short of him and goes through him for four!
shorter ball, he cuts off the back foot to cover-point
slid through, he's back and defending
tossed up, he reaches forward and defends on the front foot
straighter on middle and leg, he stretches out and defends
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover-point but can't beat the man
fuller length, he pushes on the front foot towards cover
good length, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot to cover-point
fuller length outside off, he pushes a drive firmly to mid off
shorter length, hurries him as he tries to pull, he mistimes it to midwicket and looks for one but is wisely sent back by Maxwell
136kph, full angled into leg stump, he glances this nicely down to fine leg
full outside off, he drives this with ease through cover, and Abid runs around from deep point but slides too early, he misfields on the rope to allow three
he is back and punching this to point, Shan races in but fumbles! A clean pick up and throw might have stretched the batsmen
sweeps from middle stump to deep fine leg
short drag down and he's back and pounding a pull shot through midwicket! Nice footwork from Maxwell to seize on the short length
looped up on middle and leg, he drives to long on
shorter length, he's back and working this to midwicket
beaten by a top spinner. It was a good length outside off, he played for the wrong un and it bounced a touched and beat the inside edge as he pushes away from his body
good length, outside off, he pushes from the crease to the gap at cover-point
139kph, fuller length, he drives handsomely but straight to mid off
138kph, angled into middle and leg, he clips this neatly through square midwicket to the sweeper in the deep
fuller outside off, he drives slowly to mid off and goes with the stroke for a single
good length, fourth stump line, he pushes on the front foot dragging it to midwicket
136kph, full angled into off, he drives with the full face straight of mid on and pinches a single as the man has to move to his left on the circle
full outside off, tailing away a touch, he square drives but doesn't time it, picking out backward point
good length wide of off, he tries to open the face and run it to third man but Shan darts across from backward point to cut it off with a good dive
144kph, shorter length, he's back and running this past Shan this time to wide third man for a single
back of a length outside off, he's back and opening the face to dab this to the gap at gully for a single
fuller on middle, he turns the wrists and works this through midwicket and calls two straight away. They run well and get back easily
143kph, yorker on off, he squeezes it out to backward point and again Shan makes a good stop diving to his right
shorter length but cramping him for room, he tries to late cut but chops a bottom edge to the keeper
bouncer, 130kph, that sticks in the wicket a touch, he tries to pull but mistimes it to midwicket
120kph, back of a length, top of off, he stands tall and punches to mid on
slower ball bouncer outside off and he leaves this alone
well directed short ball at the body but he controls a pull shot well to the man at deep square
huge LBW appeal but not out. It was full and tailing late back into Carey, he was hit flush on the front pad but it was sliding down leg
good length, off stump, he just pushes from the crease towards mid on on the circle
145kph, over-pitched and he drives very elegantly wide of cover, forcing deep cover-point to come around and cut it off
141kph, good length angled across, he opens the face and runs this neatly to third man
120kph slower ball outside off, deceives him as he pushes away from his body, he gets a thick inside edge that runs away behind square
short slower ball, he watches it closely and controls a pull shot behind square into the gap and again they run really well for two
145kph full toss outside off and he misses attempting a booming drive. It beat him for speed
131kph, full targeting middle, he stays leg side and punches a drive to mid on who stays right on the circle and allows one
good length, angled into leg, he defends from the crease, cramped for room
good length off cutter on middle, he tucks this off the pads forward of square for a single
short slower ball, Maxwell waits and pulls this well but straight to the man at wide fine leg
yorker length, middle and leg, he glances this to fine leg with the angle
slower short ball and he toe-ends it in the air and it falls safely at cover-point! It was so slow off the pitch he got through the pull shot too soon but it fell safely
drifting down leg and it's called wide
short and wide, he chops a cut shot though cover-point and the sweeper has to sprint in off the rope to prevent the Australians taking a second. They wanted it
shorter outside off, he's back and forcing this firmly to deep cover-point
full and drifting into leg, he drives firmly to long on. 50 for Maxwell. Two in a row
reverse sweep gets a top edge at it just balloons over Hasnain's head! He was back-pedalling at short third man but it just cleared him!
boom! Over long on! Into the upper deck! This was in the slot and he cleared the left leg and swung hard. It made a superb sound off the bat as he struck it so sweetly. It went 99 metres!
shorter length, he's back and tucking this square of midwicket
88kph shorter leg break, he's back trying to pull, it slides on, catches the inside edge and hits the inside of the knee
slower leg break, wide of off, he tries to cut and misses
off the back foot over the sight screen! Are you kidding! It was fractionally short, he hung back, cleared the front leg and slapped it straight back down the ground over the sight screen! Ridiculous
shorter and wider, he's back and cutting to deep point
slider wide of off, he's placing this nicely wide of deep cover-point and they run well for two
fuller outside off, he reaches out and defends to mid off
138kph, good length tailing into middle, he clears the front leg and miscues a heave, it rolls slowly to mid off but they get an easy one
good length, tailing away from the left-hander, he gets it off the toe of the bat to backward point
123kph, slower ball on middle and leg, he pushes on the front foot straight to cover
142kph, short ball, he is surprised by the bounce and just rolls a pull shot behind square for a single
backs away early, Hasnain fires a full wide delivery and he reaches out but misses
he steps back and across and tucks a fuller delivery neatly towards mid on for a single
full down the leg side, he glances it fine on the full and it bounces off the popping crease but Rizwan makes a great diving save to his left to save four runs
short slower ball, he controls a pull shot getting into the line and rolling it to fine leg
128kph, yorker, tailing into leg, he backs away and jams this out through midwicket
full toss, he backs away and slices this high over mid off who is inside the circle, but he didn't middle it, it lands just short of the rope but doesn't reach the rope and they get two
he charges and backs away, Junaid delivers a short 102kph, bouncer wide of off and it's not called wide. Looked the right call but Maxwell was annoyed.
another slower ball bouncer, he tries to pull, gets through the shot and is deceived by the slowness, gets a thin edge but it falls well short of Rizwan
slower ball banged in, he tries to pull but it just dies off the surface, he gets a bottom edge that bounces to the keeper
144kph, half-volley, he clears the front leg and drives but straight t cover
short ball and Carey waits and cracks a pull shot through square leg! That was powerfully struck to beat the sweeper. He waited on that nicely
short and wide and cut powerfully past backward point! Hasnain pays dearly for not delivering slower balls. He used the pace and smoked it through point
full and wide and he hammers a square drive through cover-point, they push for two but the sweeper cuts it off
back of a length on off, he steps inside the line and pulls this along the ground to fine leg
short slower ball, he pulls off the toe of the back through midwicket, Maxwell calls for two but Saad Ali races off the rope at midwicket and does well to prevent a second run
full and tailing into leg, he squirts this out through midwicket for a single
slower ball bouncer but it's too high and rightly called wide
short ball and pulled powerfully behind square! He finally gets this one away after much frustration. He waited on it well
full wide yorker, he reaches out and slices this along the ground to third man

beautifully bowled but Rizwan misses it to allow byes! It tailed in through the gate from a good length, it just missed leg stump and it kept tailing further after it went past the stumps and Rizwan couldn't stop it
full yorker on leg, he digs this out towards mid on
135kph, back of a length, he flat bats a pull shot hard to wide long on for a single

bowled him! But it's a no-ball! 142kph full and straight and it crashed into middle but he over-stepped! Maxwell was walking off but the TV replay showed he had over-stepped comfortably. Maxwell gets another life
launched over square leg one bounce four! Again full and straight, Maxwell sets himself for this one, opens up his hips and flicks it over forward square
full and straight again, he hangs back and drags it to midwicket for a single
139kph, full wide yorker beats the flashing blade of Carey. Well bowled
nearly a run out! Direct hit from Haris would have had him from mid off! It was a short slower ball, he slapped it to mid on on the circle, Carey gave up but the throw was wide
full outside off, he opens the face and slices this to third man
he charges and backs away, Junaid follows him and jams him up with a good yorker, all he can manage is a single
130kph, length ball, tailing in, he tries to launch down the ground but miscues off the inside half of the bat through square midwicket
sets up for the scoop and gets it over the keeper's head! Brilliant. He set up early, got the low full toss he wanted and he just ramped it over Rizwan's head for four. So skilful.
length ball, he steps inside the line and miscues a heave behind square leg
good length, top of off, he stays still and smacks this firmly straight of deep midwicket and into the gap, they are able to run two
full inswinging yorker, he gets an inside edge onto pad, it runs into the off side for a single

he's nearly run out! He smashed it back at the bowler, Shinwari put his hands up, and knocked it up in the air, they run but the ball rolled behind Shinwari and hit the stumps at the non-striker's but the bails didn't come off! Carey was out. But he survives and gets 50!
brilliant stroke! Length ball, he steps inside the line and flicks it fine for four! Into the 90s now
full outside off, he steers this with the angle through backward point
angled into leg, he flicks this off the pads behind square into the vacant outfield and they pick up two
low full toss, he clears the left leg and hammers it straight to mid off and Haris is able to stop it
he ramps this over the fine short third man! He shaped for the leg side ramp, it was angled across, he opened the face and ramped it over short third man! Incredible skills
full and wide, he reaches and slaps it through point to the sweeper

he's run out trying to get back on strike! It was full outside off, he slices this high over backward point, they take one and sprint back for a second, but the throw from the deep by Shan Masood was superb, right alongside the bails, Rizwan barely had to move his gloves and Maxwell was caught just short!
full inswinging yorker, 142kph, he clears the left leg and jams it out to mid off
full outside off, he steers this through point to the man in the deep
full outside off, he mistimes a drive to Yasir at cover and they only get one

caught at mid off! A low full toss does the job. It just tailed away from Carey late as he swung hard trying to get it down the ground, he hit it off the toe of the bat and it floated down the throat of Haris on the circle at mid on
on a length and angled across Shan, who raises his hands to leave
chopped down to gully, but it's stopped by the fielder
past the outside edge, in the channel outside off and Shan pokes at it with flat feet
straighter this time from Coulter-Nile, and Shan taps it back at him

bowled off the inside edge! Coulter-Nile hits the seam off a full length, Shan driving airily at it but inside-edging onto his own stumps. An early incision for Australia, and as Shan trudges off Mickey Arthur has his head in his hands
long half volley, quite wide of off, but Haris can't find the middle of his drive just yet
Kane Richardson hits a length, just outside off, and Abid defends from the crease
speared down the leg side, and he'll have to bowl this one again
and he's off the mark almost straight away, glancing neatly through midwicket for a brace
crunch! Abid's forward into a drive that threads the gap at cover, but it's pulled in by a sliding Finch near the boundary
Haris walks into a firm push, on the up, and it's a good-looking shot but finds point
punched to cover, where the fielder pulls off a diving stop but can't quite stop the single
Coulter-Nile tests him with a short one, and Abid doesn't look entirely comfortable as he pulls one-handed, but manages to keep it down
whipped off the hips and down to fine leg for a single
Abid keeps his left elbow nice and high and his bat perfectly straight as he comes forward to defend
Coulter-Nile hits a length just outside off, but he's flicked into space on the leg side and a single is the result
Kane keeps it tight on off stump, Abid leaning half forward to defend
Abid's forward to drive, but it comes off the very bottom of the bat and goes nowhere
Abid's a bit more fluent on the pull this time, swiveling and rolling his wrists, but he picks out short fine leg
there's the middle! This is just short of a good length, outside off, and Abid picks up the length very early, rocking back to pull well in front of square and right out of the middle. Boom!
sharp stop by a diving midwicket. This would have been another boundary had he not dived down at it, so sweetly was it struck. Off the front foot this time
a scything square slash bursts through the left hand of point, and it's a single as he takes some of the vim out of the shot
whipped away for a single
sweetly driven by Abid, who steps forward into the perfect position before lacing a classical cover drive through the off side field. He holds his balance and the shot
this isn't quite there to drive, but fast hands from Abid means the cover fielder is tested
through cover point now! Abid leans back as Coulter-Nile offers width outside off, standing up and punching square
fiercely struck once again, but Maxwell at point stops this cleanly. It was four if he missed it
a controlled pull sends the ball bouncing out to deep square leg, and they're through for one
Richardson aims for the top of off, but it's kept out with solid defence
punched firmly, on the up, but a dive at cover saves runs. Abid is putting these fielders under pressure
down to fine leg! Abid hops into a whip-pull as Richardson strays down leg, placing it past short fine leg and away for four
strong wristwork from Abid sends the ball racing out to deep midwicket, and it's stopped in the deep
Abid glances in front of his pads, and the man at deep backward square has work to do
Haris leans forward into a languid drive, a diving Maxwell at point cutting it off
it's short, and Abid leans back into a strong pull, but there's protection in the deep
cries of 'catch it!' as a length delivery is worked uppishly to midwicket, but it bounces well in front of Handscomb at short midwicket
full, just outside off at around 137km/h and Haris is forward to push to point
Haris works off his hip for a single through square leg
pick-up pull, and it bounces out to deep backward square for one more
Coulter-Nile comes around the stumps, Haris tapping into the leg side
slapped through midwicket! This wasn't even all that short, but Abid picks up the length so early and whips a pull out into the deep, the ball beating a diving fielder near the boundary
sprayed down the leg side, that's wide
Stoinis stays straight, Abid working to midwicket with supple wrists
a back foot punch sends the ball bouncing towards mid on. He hit it too well for any thought of a quick single
Abid keeps his bat nice and straight to push forcefully to mid on again
offcutter at around 121km/h, and it's glanced neatly out to the man at deep midwicket
another neat little flick from Abid, but it's stopped at midwicket inside the circle
there's a woody sound as Haris leans forward to drive to mid off, not out of the middle
chipped in the air, but over the inner ring. The ball plugs in the outfield and they hurry back for a second
Haris stands tall and punches to mid on
dug in short, Haris ducking underneath it
again Haris stands at the crease as Coulter-Nile maintains his back-of-a-length approach, punching to cover
off the outside edge, but there's no slip in place and it flies down to third man for four. Haris pushed at one that left him
just short of a length, and it's pressed to mid off
tapped into space, through square leg, and he turns the strike over
tapped back to the bowler
this one angles in and holds its line, Haris flicking in front of square to raise the fifty for Pakistan. It's also the fifty stand between these two
chopped down to point
angling in once again, Haris defending from the crease
not quite full enough to draw Abid forward, and he works with the spin, through square leg
Haris nurdles uppishly into the leg side, but finds the gap
Abid nudges to leg and wants a single, but the fielder is quickly in and he's sent back

sharp spin in to him! Abid was back and across, setting himself for a cut. Is it pad first? There was definitely some bat involved. The umpire's not convinced, and Australia don't want a review. But that's his first false stroke
tapped softly into space, in front of point
Haris forces off the back foot, and a fumble from Stoinis at cover allows them to get through for one
floated up on off stump at 84km/h, not much spin first up
beaten on the cut, Haris leaning back and flashing across a googly. There was hardly room for the shot
punched through cover, off a middle stump line
pushed through a bit flatter and quicker on off stump, and Abid is into the 40s with a push in front of point
legbreak, but it's too short and Haris works him easily through midwicket
flicked off the toes and into the gap at midwicket
Lyon's turning it more than Zampa, but Abid works with the turn to find a single on the leg side
Haris is a little squared up as he closes the face of the bat on a defensive poke
front foot defence sends the ball bouncing to point
Haris stays deep, but he can't find the gap with his back foot punch into the covers
tapped towards mid on, and they seize the chance for a quick single
placed behind point, Abid setting off immediately into a run and rushing back for the second
spinning gently back into Haris, who flicks off his pads for one
Abid flicks to leg and calls immediately and loudly for a quick single
Haris comes down the track and taps the ball hard back to Zampa, who can't quite stop it cleanly
tossed up nicely on off stump, Abid coming forward to smother it
Abid spots some width and hops onto the back foot, but his slashing cut bounces straight to short third man
googly from Zampa, but it's read and kept out by Abid
gem of a delivery! Turn and bounce for Lyon, and Haris can't put bat to ball with his defensive push
slightly flatter at 87km/h, and it's forced to cover
nudged into space, wide of mid on
worked with the spin into the leg side
Abid aims straighter with his nudge this time, and finds the gap for a single
thumped down to long off for a single that keeps him on strike
tossed right up to him, Haris flicking off his toes for a single
googly, but it's read and solidly defended to cover
legbreak this time, and quite flat at 89km/h. Abid keeps his back foot anchored and pokes defensively at it
Zampa lets slip with a low full toss, just outside off, but it's only a single to long off
floated up very full, and Haris digs it out back to the bowler
Haris jumps out to meet it on the full and thumps a drive out to the cover sweeper
pushed through nice and full at 89km/h, Haris pushing it back down the track
Haris uses his wrists to work the ball wide of long on, and it's placed well enough for a second run
caught at cover! Haris jumps out at Lyon again, looking to slap the ball up and over cover. But he can't get under it, sending a head-high catch to Maxwell
he skips down first ball and drives nicely back to the bowler
advances again, not quick to the pitch, whipping to midwicket
looped up outside off, he stretches forward to smother the spin
tossed up outside off, he square drives firmly to deep cover-point
short drag down, he's back and cracking a pull shot straight to midwicket and Stoinis makes the save
fuller on middle, he drives down to long on
shorter ball, he's back and pulling firmly to long on
looped up slow outside off, it spins away and beats the edge. Beautifully bowled
short slow and wide, 75kph, he's back and waiting, and waiting, and then cutting to deep cover-point
full toss and he reaches outside off and hammers a sweep hard forward of square! He smoked that very hard to beat the sweeper on the rope
looped slower on a good length outside off, he defends from the crease
nice over-spin, he's back and defending from the crease
slower outside off, he skips down the track and is beaten in flight, he works this to midwicket
tossed up, he advances and thrusts his pad at it to kick it away
another sweep from outside off and he gets this behind square! He is waiting for the length, he plays a textbook sweep from outside off roping it through square leg
floated up slowly, 77kph, on middle, he defends
tossed up on middle, he drives down to long on. 50 on debut for Abid Ali. He is very happy about it
another sweep for four! This again from way outside off. The reach and skill to flick it behind square is brilliant
drag down and he is back and hammering a pull shot high over deep midwicket! Finch under pressure
flatter on middle, he defends from the crease
another sweep behind square! He keeps feeding the length, Rizwan was down on one knee, smashing it from middle and leg behind square for four!
a paddle sweep with the turn fine but they will only get one
tossed up outside off, he reaches out and defends

run out chance but he dives in! He whipped it to midwicket and ran on Maxwell, the throw was just wide as Rizwan dived in and he would have been out with a direct hit but was home as Lyon took the ball
shorter length, he's quickly back and pulling hard to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, he defends from the crease off a thick outside edge
floated up outside off, he defends to the gap at point and calls immediately for a single
tossed up on leg, he dabs this close into the on side and they run well to pinch one
good length on middle, he sits back and tucks it to the gap at square leg
slightly shorter, he's back and cutting firmly to deep cover-point
on leg stump, he sweeps nicely behind square and Handscomb makes an excellent diving save to keep it to one
full toss outside leg, he sweeps but mistimes this to deep backward square
good length on leg stump, he's back and whipping this through square leg to the sweeper
tossed up, he reaches out and chips it in the air but safely wide of Lyon towards long on
dances down quickly and drives along the ground to long on
85kph, off break wide of off, he opens the face and runs it to short third man
off break outside off, he covers up with a solid forward defence
shorter length, he's back quickly and punching inside out past cover-point to the man in the deep
beaten by a quicker one that didn't turn. He played from the crease, expecting sharp turn but it zipped past the edge
full and drifting into leg, he tries launch this down the ground, gets a thick inside edge that runs to fine leg
leg break on middle, he paddle sweeps fine for a single
quicker and flatter, he's back and it's nearly squeezing through as he jams the bat down
shorter length, he gets down on one knee and paddles it fine for a single
quicker leg break, 91kph, he defends in hope on the front foot getting a thick inside edge onto pad
googly on middle and leg, he defends and turns it behind square for one
shorter length, he's back and punching this to deep cover-point
looped up outside leg, he glances with the angle but Handscomb makes a nice diving save at short fine
beaten by one that drifts across and slides on outside off
quicker and flatter on middle, he's back and defending
he punches on the back foot in the air but just short of cover
fuller on middle, he shovels a drive firmly with the bottom hand to long on on the bounce
shorter on leg, he's back and working this to deep square
looped up on off, he defends into the off side and they run brilliantly to pinch a single
full leg break, he's down on one knee and hammering a cover drive to the man in the deep. He struck that powerfully and Coulter-Nile makes a sliding save on the rope.
shorter length, he's back and pulling to midwicket
drifting down leg, he sweeps nicely fine for two more
a slog sweep to deep midwicket! Brilliant placement! It was looped up, he got down one knee and smacked up over deep midwicket and found the gap! It bounced just short of going all the way
drifting across, pitching on off, he defends on the front foot
he miscues this in the air just past the bowler, Maxwell just couldn't reach it with his left hand, it goes straight of long on for two
flatter on middle, he defends on the front foot
he skips down and is beaten in flight, gets a thick outside edge that goes to cover
backs away early outside leg, Maxwell fires it outside leg to cramp him. Well bowled
fuller on leg, he drives firmly to long on
leg break, full outside off, he drives inside out through cover, and it's well placed for two
drifting into leg stump, he defends into the leg side for a single
nearly caught at mid on! It was short, he was back, he miscued a pull shot in the air wide of mid on, Handscomb runs to his right and dives but it was just short of him
fuller outside off, he gets down low and delicately opens the blade and dabs it fine past the keeper's gloves, brilliant skill, and he picks up two
he dabs again from off stump, fine of short third man and runs two more
flatter on middle, he defends with soft hands to the gap at point
full on leg, he sweeps firmly behind square for a single
an appeal for caught behind!? Given not out. It slid on with the arm past the edge and Carey took the bails off but his back foot was down
tossed up on leg, he's down the track and driving to long on
87kph, drifting outside off, he pushes from the crease to cover
tossed up on off, he drives neatly to long on
tossed up, a full toss, he whips firmly to wide long on, Coulter-Nile slips in the outfield and it allows a second run
125kph, short ball, he pulls firmly through midwicket for two more
full angled into off, he flicks this with a turn of the wrists behind square for a single
short and wide, he stands up and cracks a cut shot to deep cover-point
shorter length, he's back and punching to cover
he charges down the track and pulls a short ball firmly to deep square
shorter and wider of off, he runs this off the open face to third man
good length on middle, he's back and working this to midwicket
good length on leg, he just tucks this around the corner to square leg
round arm delivery, it doesn't bounce as expected, he chops a cut shot to cover
good length on middle and leg, he sits back and tucks this square of midwicket
on the front foot he turns the wrists and works it to the gap at midwicket
he tries to paddle sweep but picks out short fine
good length outside off, he tries to drive on the up but drags it back to the bowler
slower ball off cutter, grips in the surface, he plays from the crease dragging it to mid on
shorter length, wide of off, he's back and running this to third man
slower ball banged in, he has to pull awkwardly but controls it well enough to deep square leg
shorter length, he stands tall and punches back to the bowler
short and wide, he late cuts nicely but straight to the man at wide third man
full on leg, 133kph, he clips this beautifully through midwicket for a couple. Another 50 for Rizwan. He's played very well
back of a length wide of off, he sits back and runs this off the open face to third man
back of a length on off, he flicks this superbly with the bottom hand behind square and Lyon has to make a diving save in the deep
short length and he cracks a pull shot forward of square this time for two more

edged and it flies wide of Carey! This was a good delivery, tempting the drive but it was not that full, a genuine outside edge and it's well wide of the diving keeper and races to the fine third man rope!
shorter length, he's back and whipping this powerfully to midwicket but can't beat the fieldsman
fuller outside off, he drives neatly to deep cover-point
131kph, bouncer, he ducks underneath it comfortably
good slower ball, outside off, deceives him completely as he tries to force off the back foot, beating the edge
another edge flies fine of third man! He tried to late cut this but the extra bounce forced the edge, it flies away at a rate of knots to the rope.
back of a length on off, he defends on the back foot
128kph, another bouncer, not that short, but he sways underneath it
fuller on off, he defends on the front foot to cover
shorter and wider, he cuts hard but straight to Maxwell at backward point
cracking pull shot off the front foot wide of mid on, who is in the circle, but it slows up on the outfield because of the dew
this pull shot makes the rope! This was shorter but it was only chest high, he swivelled and hammered it behind square and it raced to the rope
back of a length outside off, he runs this to third man

almost run out by a Maxwell direct hit! He dabbed it to point and point and took off, Maxwell swooped to his right, wrong man to take on, he fired at the non-striker's and just missed! Abid was short of his ground as he dived
slid through on off, he defends from the crease
huge LBW appeal. Not out. Did he hit it? No review from Australia. It looked close as he tried to pull a straighter ball
fuller outside off, he pushes this down the ground to long off
he skips down and stays leg side to lift this up and over the off side but it lands short of deep cover-point
full toss, he just nudges this to midwicket
drifting into leg, he skips down and drives to long off
he comes down the track, getting to the pitch, and works a single down to long on
rushing straight on with the arm, Abid reading it and pushing to cover
tapped close in on the leg side but into the gap, and they run a quick single

beaten on the slog sweep and Carey has the bails off in a flash. It doesn't look like his back foot left the crease, and Rizwan rolls onto his back to have a stretch after missing the shot. A spot of cramp, perhaps? But he's good to go
another sweep, and he lays a good chunk of bat on this one and places it nicely behind square to collect another boundary and push Pakistan forward
tossed up on off stump, delivered from around the stumps, and it's squirted into a gap at cover for a quick single
there's the sweep again, and he connects well but the fielder is in position to stop it - and this is now Pakistan's highest third wicket ODI stand against Australia

pushed through by Zampa, and Abid misses the ball as he flicks across his front pad. It looked like it might be headed down the leg side, and Umpire Dharmasena turns the appeal down. Australia reckon he's out - or at least hope so - and they ask for a review. Two reds and an umpire's call on the ball tracker! So Abid survives, on 98
and he's up to 99 now, glancing through square leg for one
down the track comes Rizwan, and he slams a drive back at Zampa
legbreak, flat on off stump, the ball taking the inside edge of a defensive push
Rizwan jumps down the track, but Zampa adjusts his length and he can only defend

there it is! A hundred on debut for Abid Ali. He's playing his first international at 31, and he wasn't even supposed to be playing today. And now he's become the third Pakistani to score a hundred on his ODI debut
Rizwan is down on bended knee and sets himself for a late cut, but the ball rushes past him
Rizwan uses strong wrists to get the ball out to deep midwicket, rushing back for a second run
tapped back to the bowler
wristed to wide long on! Rizwan uses his feet to get close to it, once again using those powerful wrists to fetch the ball powerfully into the leg side. It's perfectly placed too
Lyon offers width, but it's just a single out to the sweeper
pushed firmly back to the bowler
a paddle sweep gets it down to fine leg
another paddle sweep, and this one goes even finer
slogged up and over mid on, who is up. It's played slightly awkwardly, but lands safely. And that takes Abid to the record for highest score on debut for Pakistan, beating Saleem Elahi's record
<b>clears the left leg<b>, and this time he nails the slog sweep, right into the gap

three slog sweeps in a row, but he can't lay a bat on this one. Carey whips the bails off, and there's an appeal ... but it's for caught behind! The umpire says no, so Australia go upstairs for a review. But there's nothing on UltraEdge, so the decision will stand
pushed back to the bowler
Rizwan skips out and sends a drive skimming to cover, where it's stopped by Finch - but not quickly enough to stop the single
short third man tumbles to his left to stop a very late dab, just the single
Rizwan fetches a sweep from outside off, another quick single
sliced very fine down towards third man, Khawaja sliding to keep the ball inside the rope down there. He dabbed it right off the stumps, very late
slapped through cover, one more

a fantastic knock comes to an end! Abid gets down low to slog into the leg side, but slices under the ball to send a swirling chance out to Finch, who makes no mistake. It was a slightly tired looking shot. But he's put his team in a winning position on debut
he comes forward and checks a drive to cover, who gets low to stop it
legbreak, and it grips a little as Umar gets forward again to defend
short, on off stump, and Umar cuts hard into the ground, the ball bouncing up to be stopped by point
too short again, and Umar's off the mark with a pull out to deep midwicket
a nicely-placed cut bounces out to the deep, behind square, and they're back for a second
well-placed again by Umar, angling a push to get the ball past a diving Khawaja at short third man
punched down to long on for a single
eased down to long on, and the strike is turned over once more
a sliced drive dribbles through point for one more
this one slips out as a low full toss, and it's whipped through midwicket for two more

played on! Coulter-Nile returns and strikes straight away. Umar was looking to get after him, swinging wildly into the leg side, but the under edge instead sends the ball onto his own stumps. Could there be a twist in the tail? This isn't an easy track to start on
enter Saad Ali, who is also on his debut. He's off the mark straight away, nudging off his pads and calling Rizwan through for a hard-run two
chopped down through gully, but Maxwell dives at backward point to stop the run
angled, but finer this time, and there's an easy single to third man
Coulter-Nile aims full, and it's dug out through mid on
full and straight, Coulter-Nile stopping it in his follow through as it's pushed back at him
appeal for lbw as Rizwan misses a sweep and his hit on the pad, but the umpire's not convinced. Maxwell floated that one up really high
flatter, shorter, and it's punched through cover
another appeal! Saad is hit on the pad as he looks to glance, but it looked like the ball was headed down the leg side anyway
a late cut sends the ball bouncing to backward point
chopped hard through cover, and there's an immediate call for two. It's a good call, and they're back safely
another sweep, and Zampa fumbles his stop at short fine leg ... but they opt not to run off the misfield
glanced to midwicket, into the gap
Saad steps into a crunchy drive, and he wants two but he's sent back. It would have been very tight
short of a length, just outside off, and Rizwan slugs a front-foot pull out to midwicket, moving into the 90s
a firm drive finds mid off
worked neatly off the hip, the ball bouncing out to deep square leg
nice yorker from Coulter-Nile, and it's backed up by Maxwell at point, who dives to stop the ball as it's dug out square
punched down the ground for one
Maxwell lobs a full one up on a leg stump line, from around the wicket, and Rizwan sweeps down to fine leg. It's placed well enough for a second run. Quick running

paddled fine, and Pakistan find a vital boundary! Maxwell fired this one in quicker, but Rizwan was waiting for it with another paddle sweep, getting it fine of Zampa and hitting it well enough for the ball to beat him to the boundary
he's down the track to get to the pitch, working down to long on
Saad comes down the track and is almost beaten behind his legs, but gets some pad on it to find a leg bye
Saad spots some width, slicing it square for a single to keep the strike, 11 off the over
Saad falls! He was looking for a big pick-up shot over the leg side, but didn't connect well. Richardson holds a simple chance in the deep. Is panic setting in?
swatted uppishly into the leg side, but falling safely in front of the fielder
Imad whips a length delivery out to one of the three at deep midwicket
very full, on off stump, and Rizwan goes to 99 by driving down to long on
punched firmly back at the bowler, who can't quite get down quickly enough to stop it, but Lyon comes around from mid off to ensure it's another dot
Imad backs away and rifles a shot into the off side, but he can't beat Lyon at mid off

short, outside off, and it's slapped hard out to the sweeper for Rizwan to raise his second hundred of the series. And this is only the second time that two Pakistan batsmen have scored ODI hundreds in the same chase
big swish outside off, but he hits only fresh air!

caught at deep point! Imad backs away and hacks at a slower bouncer. He can't get any distance on the shot though, and can't control it either. Marsh comes in off the boundary and holds a simple catch, Australia grab another!
another play and a miss! Richardson is opting for a short-pitched approach, and Rizwan just cut underneath it
this will help a little, Rizwan sprinting down the track and flat-batting another short one straight back over Richardson's head
on a length, straight, and Rizwan is furious with himself as he can only push it back to the bowler. He was looking for a single to keep the strike
just short of a good length, Yasir slugging it straight down the ground. Long on cleans up, and they only take a single
an attempted slower bouncer goes awry, looping way down the leg side

caught at deep backward square! It was pitched up, on his legs, and Rizwan actually got an excellent connection on this pick-up over the leg side. But he picked out Handscomb precisely in that position
short, rising over off stump, and Yasir can only pull to long on
slammed over long off! It was just a good old fashioned slog, but it's cleared the fielder at the boundary to keep Pakistan hoping

another slog, but this one is caught! It was the slow bouncer, and Shinwari tried to smash it over midwicket. But he got more height than distance, and Handscomb holds another catch. Barring anything silly from Australia, this match is now sealed
another slow bouncer, it's pulled out to deep square leg, and that's the game
